She made a table used for chatting and drinking in ancient China. At the very beginning, when ancient poets and writers were having a picnic, they sat on the bank of a beautiful creek, reciting poems and reading books aloud. When everyone talks about being happy, they put the wine glass in the water, and the wine glass drifts slowly with the flow of water. When the wine glass stops at someone's position, he will drink the wine and read a poem aloud, winning everyone's applause and admiration. Often these poets will make beautiful poems on the spot because of the beautiful scenery and happy mood after drinking. But when it rains, there is no way to hold these gatherings in the wild, so they made this kind of table imitating the environment of the creek, chanting poetry and gathering indoors. Later, these habits gradually diversified. It can also be that everyone sits together and chats and drinks tea, tastes pure natural food, enjoys the gifts of nature, and praises the greatness and love of the Creator. Japan also retains these traditions.  At the end of the video, Li Ziqi recites an ancient poem, the general idea is as follows: when we are most proud of our lives, we must sing and dance to our heart's content, and don't let the beautiful wine glasses be without wine. Under the moonlight, the transparent luminous wine glass is always full of amber wine, which can be enjoyed at any time. On such a beautiful night, the moon will praise you for good wine and your happiness.
Very very good and excellent work so proud you mam....

The table is from an idiom æ›²æ°´æµè§, a way of drinking in ancient China. It became famous  1,700 years ago when a group of most famous scholars at that time (Jin Dynasty) gathered by a winding creek, drinking and writing poems. This is recorded in the most famous calligraphic work in Chinese history by Wang Xizhi, a witness of the event in a prose  å…°äº­é›†åº. Those who attend are supposed to be able to make poems impromptu. At the end of the video, the diners try to come up with a poem he/she knows, reflecting the tradition.

The tea table with flowing water is a symbol of a traditional folk custom (æ›²æ°´æµè§ï¼‰of the Han ethnicity in ancient China, which later developed into a kind of elegant thing for literati to sing poems and wine. On the third day of March in the lunar calendar, people hold the Shangsi festival. After the ceremony, everyone sat on both sides of the river and placed wine cups on the upper stream. The wine cups went down the river. Whoever stopped in front of the river would take a drink, which meant to get rid of misfortune. This kind of traditional history is very old, can be traced back to the early Western Zhou Dynasty

She made a table used for chatting and drinking in ancient China. At the very beginning, when ancient poets and writers were having a picnic, they sat on the bank of a beautiful creek, reciting poems and reading books aloud. When everyone talks about being happy, they put the wine glass in the water, and the wine glass drifts slowly with the flow of water. When the wine glass stops at someone's position, he will drink the wine and read a poem aloud, winning everyone's applause and admiration. Often these poets will make beautiful poems on the spot because of the beautiful scenery and happy mood after drinking. But when it rains, there is no way to hold these gatherings in the wild, so they made this kind of table imitating the environment of the creek, chanting poetry and gathering indoors. Later, these habits gradually diversified. It can also be that everyone sits together and chats and drinks tea, tastes pure natural food, enjoys the gifts of nature, and praises the greatness and love of the Creator. Japan also retains these traditions.  At the end of the video, Li Ziqi recites an ancient poem, the general idea is as follows: when we are most proud of our lives, we must sing and dance to our heart's content, and don't let the beautiful wine glasses be without wine. Under the moonlight, the transparent luminous wine glass is always full of amber wine, which can be enjoyed at any time. On such a beautiful night, the moon will praise you for good wine and your happiness.

As a post-90s generation from China, my growth experience is similar to that of Li Ziqi. When I was a child, there was no mobile phone, no internet, no toys. I was playing in the fields with my friends, herding cattle and playing games in the mountains. The happiness at that time was very simple. When harvesting rice in the summer, I was exposed to the big sun. Although I was reluctant, I would also participate in labor. My parents would reward me for eating watermelon and popsicles. In the evening, I met my friends to watch local dramas under the moonlight. Everything is beautiful and carefree. Last year, due to the epidemic, I experienced many farming tasks at home, including planting rice seedlings, harvesting, and planting peanuts.

Saw a lot comments about people commenting negatively on her videos. As someone who has grown up in the village living similar life, now living in urban areas, I can vouch that this is not fake. There probably are more people helping her in the process (which is necessary) however doesn't take away the credit she has earned as she is heavily involved on it. The whole process is exactly similar to how my grandmother used to make quilt from cotton. It takes a lot of effort and patience. Before the winter, when we needed new quilt, the whole family would help in making the quilts (5 to 6 quilts at a time). I even remember the sweet taste of cotton flowers when it is raw.
I love all the dogs and cats that run around the yard and follow her while she does her crafts. So talented!
